intro: Sida aesculifolia, commonly known as the horse radish plant, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its alternate, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Sida aesculifolia is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to a wide range of environmental conditions.
